project_abstract.cdata: The Third Xinjiang Highway project aims to improve transport infrastructure, and sector governance in support of socioeconomic development in Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, in Western China. To meet its development objective, the components will: 1) include the construction of a four lane expressway, and additional two lanes in the Kuitun-SailimuHu Highway, as well as upgrading the existing two lane roads to Class 1 (and/or Class 2) standard, combining new, and existing alignments. An eighty percent of the KuiSai highway will use the existing alignment, while new alignments will mostly serve as bypasses to urbanized areas in Wusu, and Jinghe; 2) connect primary local roads, and townships to the provincial, and national highway system, to ensure access to rural areas, and poor counties. The component will entail a four-year rehabilitation program, implemented under a programmatic approach; and, 3) strengthen institutional capacity, by providing training assistance, and specialized equipment, to address sector issues, key in preparing future sector reforms. This includes traffic safety, highway toll management, road management and maintenance, and transport facilitation.

P058847.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>ZH</LangCode><ProjectName>第三新疆公路项目</ProjectName><ProjectAbstract>该项目的目的是帮助中国西部的新疆维吾尔自治区改善交通基础设施和加强交通部门管理，从而促进新疆的经济和社会发展。项目内容包括：（1）缓解邻近哥萨克斯坦边界的奎屯－塞里木的区域和国际贸易走廊的交通拥挤状况，增加交通流量；（2）通过一项地方公路网恢复计划改善部分贫困地区的交通条件；（3）提高公路网管理的效率和效益。</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>
